texts.value: Regulation of processes involving cell contact and adhesion such as growth control, tumor invasion, and metastasis. Negative regulator of EGFR signaling pathway. Forms complexes with beta-catenin and gamma-catenin/plakoglobin. Beta-catenin may be a substrate for the catalytic activity of PTPRK/PTP-kappa
High levels in lung, brain and colon; less in liver, pancreas, stomach, kidney, placenta and mammary carcinoma
Belongs to the protein-tyrosine phosphatase family. Receptor class 2B subfamily

citation.title: Association of human protein-tyrosine phosphatase kappa with members of the armadillo family.
Molecular cloning and chromosomal localization of a human gene homologous to the murine R-PTP-kappa, a receptor-type protein tyrosine phosphatase.
The DNA sequence and analysis of human chromosome 6.
The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).
An unbiased screen identifies DEP-1 tumor suppressor as a phosphatase controlling EGFR endocytosis.
Glycoproteomics analysis of human liver tissue by combination of multiple enzyme digestion and hydrazide chemistry.
Mass-spectrometric identification and relative quantification of N-linked cell surface glycoproteins.
An enzyme assisted RP-RPLC approach for in-depth analysis of human liver phosphoproteome.

referencePositions: IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS]

citation.title: Large-scale structural analysis of the classical human protein tyrosine phosphatome.

properties.value: Expressed in corpus callosum and 107 other tissues
